positive.review: If you love Rimworld but prefer a medieval setting to a sci-fi one, this definitely scratches the itch.

I honestly did not like it the first time i played it. I gave it another shot and im SUCKED in. 

Great colony sim. Building is decent and fun. 
would love to see more in terms of the combat side of the game but its fine as is and likely will stay pretty shallow and thats fine.

-the Ai is pretty bad though as in they cause lag, the game is not efficient in that department and slows down as you grow, which isnt abnormal for these games but worth noting.

I feel like I'm playing RimWorld but into a medieval setup with more possibilities building with the 3d voxel/layers. If you're more into building details and medieval, then this game will feel like an upgrade, still familiar and easy to take on.

I'm still exploring the game in the early stages, but I get the feeling it's a good game. So far, it is stable, smooth and I don't see anything obvious that's missing or broken except a small refresh glitch when building but nothing annoying.

I'll update later to comment if this game goes boring or not, but so far I enjoy building in voxel with familiar ai mechanics to RimWorld.

I enjoy this game but it is lacking in many ways. a big drawback is no children and no dynasty. the reason given is because of raiders but they could make it so children are either full grown or cannot be attacked or harmed. the game also lacks in the regards of no laws that ive discovered its supposed to be medieval sim there should be some form of law and even the ability to set classes among your citizens. i also dont like how water works especially if i want to make a moat or a resevoir. the game shows great potential but i dont think there are any plans to introduce the things i find lacking in this game. also lacking on leisure activities and tbh i feel the crafting is way dumbed down like i should have bakeries for bread and things like that. as far as these kind of games go though its overall decent
This game is good, you have the Rimworld mechanic but in a 3D view point, they still work on it and bring a lot of new stuff every month, the only downside would be the texture, its too bland.

There are a lot of joyless people out there that need every colony sim to be Rimworld, or have all/most of the same features and systems to be worth a damn.

This one, to me, has some obvious, standard similarities but still feels like it's own thing and I really like what it does. It's a fun one to kick back to.

Looking forward to seeing what 1.0 and beyond looks like.

I've got nearly 150 hours in this game at the moment and I plan on continuing haha.
With the new Medieval Monday Talk posted today and the wonderful journey this game has been so far, I look forward to seeing this labor of love continue.
The management elements are solid and constantly improving and the ui is easy to navigate. Though my settlers lives have been saved more than once by the in-game almanac, which is such a helpful tool I am grateful for. The search isn't super accurate but its easy enough to find what you're looking for when something doesn't pop up.
The flavour text and worldbuilding is enjoyable, the settler interactions and differing personalities help add a lot of character to the game that makes it stand out. (Winifred, my mvp may he live eternally.)
While the music is nice, it is perhaps best not to play this when too sleepy. It has lulled me into drowsiness more than once lol

This game is super fun!   So many choices to customize game play!   Watch out,  it's addictive!!

I usually play peaceful, because I love to build.  This game let's you be as creative as you want!   

Hope to see an update that simplifies tree cutting - that's about the only thing that is really tedius.

Great game!  Highly recommend!

The game has a lot of love and care put into it, always a nice fun game to sit back relax and play before realising all my food has rotted and now my settlers are starving. Then it because a nice fun game to sit back and watch my settlers suffer. The game is always being updated with clear update milestones and is always fun to go back to

While the game is clearly early access and there are a lot of things I wish it did, what is there provides a fun challenge from the regular 'defend your city builder' layout.  In some ways, it reminds me a lot of Majesty without the mythology in that your people are mostly self directed and don't always do what you want them to do.
Loved the game when it came out, and the updates keep on giving. Great to relax and play!

Both Engaging and Idle.
When I'm not battling raiders or hunting wolves, I sit and chill on the phone while my settlers go about their bussiness... Plan Out your settlement and have a blast defending it.

I love the simple but still beautiful art style, the rimworld-esque story generation and colony management elements, and the 3D map and building mechanics. This is a great cosy game for those who enjoy survival scenarios/mechanics with compelling story generation and only a little bit of light cannibalism/war crimes.
The Dev team are still really active many years after release, improving things (Such as the now drastically improved raider AI) and adding new content that makes this game even more fun to play. Especially if you are a bit of a nerd for medieval history and/or architecture.

The only thing I would love to see which I don't think has been implemented is the ability for your settlers to have kids. This isn't a huge issue for my normal playstyle though as I tend to build fortified convents/monasteries in most of my playthroughs.

I bought this game when it launched and now came back to see a lot of progress done! It has still many ways to go, but it is a solid game! If you enjoy playing games like rimworld or DF, then you surely will like this one. I love seeing my architectural creations in 3D!

Great devs, very complex and enjoyable game. I'm a peaceful player, I usually play with raids off, and there's still plenty to do without combat. I love building idyllic villages. No reproduction or children and devs say they're not going to add that, but I have hope for mods or maybe dlc in the distant future. Still, a great game even without it. If you like clanfolk, rimworld, sims, ect... you will enjoy this game.
Nice and cozy townbuilder sim, can absolutely recommend. You can go deep on trade or military might, or play on peacefull if you just want to build some castles.

Super adorable medieval building sim. Somewhat of a mixture of Sims and Minecraft.
And it's in continious development. Can get slightly addictive xD
I love this game so much, I do wish updates happened more often but I find myself playing for days at a time.
I'm very excited about the direction this game is taking, and the constant participation and updates the dev are putting in this game is simply amazing! Looking forward to the next objectives!

At first, it kind of sucked due to the lack of info, and the mechanics aren‚Äôt very easy to figure out. But once you start to understand the game, it‚Äôs epic. If you like building bases, it‚Äôs a great game.

idk m8 I don't have any criticisms except having an end goal to achieve, and they're currently working on that

game is well crafted and you'll either like the colony sim type gameplay or you don't, that just depends on personal preference
Fun management game.  I wish more devs handled early access like this game has.  Constant updates and communication.
Excellent way to spend some time building a medieval kingdom 10/10 recommend to anyone looking for a fun sim game
Nice mix between base defence and rts. Look forward to it getting finished, main drawback at this stage is learning some of the micro needed to do well.

-Start a settlement
-Prospore
-4 strangers come from a far in armor
-Die
Peak medieval experience
Definitely has the potential, still needs more contents at current state.

I've been playing Going Medieval on and off for a couple years now and I have really been enjoying it! It still needs to get fleshed out a little more but after 2 roughly 100 hour playthroughs I'm about 2/3 of the way through the research tree and still have much grander plans for my village. Additionally the developer is still continuing to make updates and seems very open to feedback, I'm very excited to see what comes next!
3d rimworld in the middle ages, fantastic!
Still in progress, but the changes were good so far.
Good. Very good. Always getting better.
Started playing it again. Still needs to work but so far its so good!
ive done about 1200hrs into this awesome game, would love an impossibe mode?!?!?!
when the game tells you to build defenses, you definitely should
great game with lots of potential
Needs controller support for handheld systems
It‚Äôs a great game with great potential.
Great destroyer of time
Terrible juegazo!! 10/10
Great relaxing game
Kinda reminds me of Oxygen not Included

multi level organization

game good

love this game

Looking for a nice colony building game? You got it.
Looking for an alternative to Rimworld? Go play Rimworld, nothing beats it.

Recommended
üí¨ 800+ hours played

I‚Äôve been playing Going Medieval since it was still in experimental/early access, and I keep coming back to it after all these years.

If you enjoy colony-building, crafting, agriculture, and survival sims, this game is an absolute gem. The building system is incredibly fun and flexible, letting you design and expand your settlement exactly how you want. I love choosing my initial settlers, managing their needs, and making sure they‚Äôre happy, healthy, and well-fed. Combat, crafting, and even tending animals all add extra layers of depth without feeling overwhelming.

The game doesn‚Äôt try to impress with flashy graphics ‚Äî instead, it keeps things simple but detailed enough to feel alive. And it works beautifully. The real ‚Äúgoal‚Äù isn‚Äôt to beat the game, but to survive and see your settlers thrive, which makes every session rewarding in its own way.

After more than 800 hours, I can say it‚Äôs very well balanced, with just the right mix of challenge and accessibility. I‚Äôd only wish for a bit more content in areas like trading ‚Äî for example, actually visiting other towns instead of just using a resource pop-up window would add a lot.

Overall, this is one of my favorite colony sims ever. A solid 9/10 ‚Äî not because it falls short, but because there‚Äôs always room to grow.
If you love Rimworld but prefer a medieval setting to a sci-fi one, this definitely scratches the itch.
Very good game ,still unfinished. Needs to add setting for auto culling animals and stop planting automatically in winter / certain quantity

The game is highly customizable and very chill, with a few sporadic raids to keep you on edge (can be turned off). Overall, as an early access game, it's very well made. A couple bugs, but that's only because there is constant new content churned out by the developers, and a bug report I made had the bug fixed quite quickly in the patch notes. 10/10, lowkey addicted.

Devs were working on this project non stop since its release. Albeit its still kind off lacking in depth vs many other well established titles, the idea and dedication alone is quite admirable by itself. Not a bad title to sink few dozen of hours into.

I honestly did not like it the first time i played it. I gave it another shot and im SUCKED in. 

Great colony sim. Building is decent and fun. 
would love to see more in terms of the combat side of the game but its fine as is and likely will stay pretty shallow and thats fine.

-the Ai is pretty bad though as in they cause lag, the game is not efficient in that department and slows down as you grow, which isnt abnormal for these games but worth noting.

Interesting. Pretty much like Stranded: Alien Dawn in a medieval setting.

I like it, and seems to be replayable to some extent.

I really appreciate how much love and effort the devs put into this game. I've been playing since early access in June 2021 and they've kept my interest in the game since then. If you love strategic medieval colony sims or just building sick fortresses then this game is for you.

I feel like I'm playing RimWorld but into a medieval setup with more possibilities building with the 3d voxel/layers. If you're more into building details and medieval, then this game will feel like an upgrade, still familiar and easy to take on.

I'm still exploring the game in the early stages, but I get the feeling it's a good game. So far, it is stable, smooth and I don't see anything obvious that's missing or broken except a small refresh glitch when building but nothing annoying.

I'll update later to comment if this game goes boring or not, but so far I enjoy building in voxel with familiar ai mechanics to RimWorld.

Hello,

I‚Äôll be honest‚ÄîI first pirated this game, but I loved it so much that I bought it. It‚Äôs incredibly addictive (ruined my sleep schedule, but that‚Äôs nothing new).

While it‚Äôs a fantastic game overall, there are a few quality-of-life improvements that could make it much smoother. As a fellow game dev, here are some ideas:

Farm Management
 - Add a Farm tab where we can custom-group crops. For example, I could stop sowing autumn crops on all crops with a single action.
 - Option to automate seasonal farming tasks.

Jobs System
 - The Job page feels intimidating at first. Hide all the individual priority boxes by default.
 - Replace with a pre-made dropdown menu (e.g., Builder, Smith, Cook), each expandable into specific priorities.
 - Allow saving custom job setups (e.g., ‚ÄúWinter Jobs,‚Äù ‚ÄúSummer Jobs‚Äù).
 - Advanced option: Assign different jobs by time of day (train in the morning, garden in the evening).

Drafting & Combat
 - Add a bulk draft button to instantly draft everyone.
 - Bonus: Add a ‚Äúfighter‚Äù checkbox per villager so only combatants get drafted, while others automatically hide.

Selection Tools
 - Selection boxes should only affect the visible layer, avoiding underground stockpiles.
 - Add a modifier (e.g., Ctrl+drag) to only select items, not villagers.

Hauling & Items
 - When selecting items, the Haul button should always appear, even if some items are forbidden or in a stock pile‚Äîjust assign what‚Äôs possible.
 - Add a ‚Äúrefresh selection‚Äù button for forbidden items after raids so we don‚Äôt have to deselect/reselect everything.
 - Double-clicking should select all connected items of the same type (e.g., every wall piece), not everything in a huge radius.

Building & Deconstruction
 - If deleting 50+ blueprint pieces, add a confirmation popup to avoid losing massive amounts of work by accident.

UI/UX
 - In the Overview tab, add a search bar for quick lookups (e.g., ‚Äútraining dummies‚Äù).
 - Add clearer guidance for room requirements‚ÄîI didn‚Äôt realize for ~50 hours that efficiency boosts require specific room setups and that was a fluke of wondering what this random button did
 - If a villager takes damage off-screen or on another layer, show a big, obvious popup (maybe even auto-pause).

Once again Id like to say this is a great game, the kind of game ive always wanted to play even with the frustrating bits

I love this game. That's all. I can play it for hours. Restart and all that. It's just a great civ builder. Concepts are simple, and citizen management isn't a pain like in some games/. Are there some things that could be better? Sure. Scrolling on your citizen list could be fixed to work properly, along with other nitpicks. But those are small punch items that devs can figure out down the road. Absolutely recommend this game for anyone who want's an intuitive, simple, and challenging (crazy that something can be all of those at once) civ builder, this is your game.

I enjoy this game but it is lacking in many ways. a big drawback is no children and no dynasty. the reason given is because of raiders but they could make it so children are either full grown or cannot be attacked or harmed. the game also lacks in the regards of no laws that ive discovered its supposed to be medieval sim there should be some form of law and even the ability to set classes among your citizens. i also dont like how water works especially if i want to make a moat or a resevoir. the game shows great potential but i dont think there are any plans to introduce the things i find lacking in this game. also lacking on leisure activities and tbh i feel the crafting is way dumbed down like i should have bakeries for bread and things like that. as far as these kind of games go though its overall decent
This game is good, you have the Rimworld mechanic but in a 3D view point, they still work on it and bring a lot of new stuff every month, the only downside would be the texture, its too bland.

There are a lot of joyless people out there that need every colony sim to be Rimworld, or have all/most of the same features and systems to be worth a damn.

This one, to me, has some obvious, standard similarities but still feels like it's own thing and I really like what it does. It's a fun one to kick back to.

Looking forward to seeing what 1.0 and beyond looks like.

Note: I played 100+ hours of "Going Medieval" on another platform; purchased on Steam to maybe use on Steamdeck/Steam Link.

I really dislike "Rimworld", but I really like "Going Medieval". Why do I bring this up? Both games are colony sims in the vein of "Dwarf Fortress", and the gameplay in both games is and feels very similar. The main difference for me is that "Going Medieval" feels a lot more rounded, deliberate, and a lot less stupidly and infuriatingly random, whilst looking better, and having a much better UI.

Since purchasing the game (for the first time) in 2021, the game has received regular updates and patches (on a monthly basis), including new features and mod support (which I have not used yet). I do agree that the Early Access phase has been long, and some more QoL features are desireable, but Foxy Voxel have certainly not been inactive!
Cracking game - a must buy if you love Rimworld with a spot of Medieval mixed in (and multiple floors!)
Fantastic gameplay and action with plenty of city building and random events keeping it interesting

I've got nearly 150 hours in this game at the moment and I plan on continuing haha.
With the new Medieval Monday Talk posted today and the wonderful journey this game has been so far, I look forward to seeing this labor of love continue.
The management elements are solid and constantly improving and the ui is easy to navigate. The search isn't super accurate but its easy enough to find what you're looking for when something doesn't pop up.

Excellent way to spend some time building a medieval kingdom 10/10 recommend to anyone looking for a fun sim game

I started playing Going Medieval recently and was immediately hooked.
Building and managing your own medieval settlement feels really satisfying.
Resource gathering, crafting, and defending your village keeps every day interesting.
The AI and random events make the game challenging but rewarding when you succeed.
Watching your settlers grow, survive, and thrive gives a real sense of accomplishment.
The graphics and sound are simple but charming and fit the game perfectly.
Every session feels different thanks to procedural maps and unpredictable events.
Micromanaging settlers can be tricky, but it adds a lot of depth and strategy.
Even after many hours, I keep discovering new ways to optimize my settlement.
If you enjoy city building with survival elements and strategy, Going Medieval is definitely worth playing.

Its a bit barebones still. Not much challenge. AI is behaving somewhat basic and the fight engine is just about the most raw shoot/bonk engine you can find. Its following Rimworld but its not even close to having all qol pieces of Rim yet. Irritating stuff like everyone being upset about seeing tons of dead bodies and there simply is no way i can tell the weak stomage civilians that a certain area is off limits for them etc. I still havent figured out how to not get civilians that wants to take a casual stroll in the flooded watertunnels to my well. They seem to find it easy to get down there but then somehow need my guidance to get out. Iv tried putting grated doors down there but my peasants only seem to be able to lock those doors from the inside. So my problem seems to need that i sacrifice a peon forever putting a odd taste to the villages drinking water. Sigh.. 
 
But it still got a nice touch to it. Erecting a building in bricks is a time consuming enterprice just as you would expect. Digging a moat took me 2 years etc. It definitly has some cool stuff in it but i would still recommend to hold off for awhile if possible. Its probably a much more enjoyable game in a year from now. And in a few years when mods is somewhere even near Rimworld then im sure this is going to be a truly cool title. They do seem to put in the effort to add stuff now and then. It dosnt scream cashgrab atleast.
Please help, Can't stop playing. Haven't slept, lost life, became the ruler of some runaway rejects and am making them build ridiculous, silly buildings.

negative.review: Low on features, but high on potential. But until/unless the optimization is fixed I cannot recommend it. The game collapses down to frames per minute after getting to the mid game.

At this state do not buy this game.
Looking at base like do game works?
Yes. BUT had some game crushing bugs like corrupting game character stuck in wall (while not building or any construction or deconstruction on map) or not building items/walls (stuck at same % for whole day so u need to "r" pawn so he start building again).
Next this game has 3D rimworld vibe but it has bugs with z lvl if u click to move pawn it do to lowest lvl possible not what u see.
Good concept ATM badly made.

This was a simple, fun, resource & population manager game. A build-your-castle-and-defend-yourself-while-growing kinda thing. 

As more and more features and changes were added, it's got to the point that there are so many intricate little fiddly things to manage that it's just not fun any more. I uninstalled it.

I find this game incredibly frustrating every settler is starving so they go fish get a huge stock pile and come home leaving the stock pile buy the river and their is no way to tell the dumb settler to collect and bring back to settlement so animals eat the fish and settlers die always.

Clear to say bad programming and I am sure their will be some menu you go in to and preform a sixteen point click exercise to get them to return food.
I actually love this game but I am going to give it a thumbs down based on the fact that the autosave freezes the game for well over 5 seconds. Ill change my revier when they fix this

I would rather play Rimworld since the system and UI used here is very similar anyway, and Rimworld has mods for medieval playthroughs as well as ones for layers so you can build multilevel buildings. I would suggest just getting Rimworld and mod it. Rimworld is older, is recieving constant updates, has a good modding community, and overall plays a lot better than this with a lot more vanilla customization to playthroughs even before adding mods.
not great. this has been done 99x ways. feels like chores on chores, and i love rimworld
meh

I enjoy the building of this game, but its all it has. outside of it, this game is so boring. the fact this has been in early access for this long is sad..the fact they are refusing to add kids and families to a medieval game is sad...but cannibalism is ok? Everytime i try to give this game a chance it feels like i am just wasting my time..

It's a barebones imitation of Rimworld with a medieval theme, z levels, 1/10th of the gameplay depth, and 1/100th of the modding community.

Game is completely broken!! I absolutely do not recommend unless you like to waste your time and rage. Generally it sucks asss, with barely any gameplay or content, AI doesnt work at all (probably the worse AI training and path finding iv ever seen anywhere, makes you wonder how people learn how to code)completely unbalanced in so many ways. You spend hours to build a village then 50 people come attack you, enemies walk straight through your frontline for your archers even if you block  a 1X1 entrance path with melle guys, 50 AI with no collision against 5 of your guys, being completely incompetent in combat, unable to go where you want them to go, unable to stand ground or to attack the right person, unable to go up or down ladders. Fun for all the wrong reasons. One iof the worse coded games iv played in a while/. Last but not least, i played this game 5 years ago, nearly nothing was added since then and its still in early access (cashcow), and it actually got worse since last time i played which is quite an achievement.
We're 4 years into development and settlers still can't marry.

At this state do not buy this game.
Looking at base like do game works?
Yes. BUT had some game crushing bugs like corrupting game character stuck in wall (while not building or any construction or deconstruction on map) or not building items/walls (stuck at same % for whole day so u need to "r" pawn so he start building again).
Next this game has 3D rimworld vibe but it has bugs with z lvl if u click to move pawn it do to lowest lvl possible not what u see.
Good concept ATM badly made.

This was a simple, fun, resource & population manager game. A build-your-castle-and-defend-yourself-while-growing kinda thing. 

As more and more features and changes were added, it's got to the point that there are so many intricate little fiddly things to manage that it's just not fun any more. I uninstalled it.

Recent update introduced a lot of bugs and performance issues.
Plus the developers/moderators are pretty unfriendly and hostile towards the community.

I find this game incredibly frustrating every settler is starving so they go fish get a huge stock pile and come home leaving the stock pile buy the river and their is no way to tell the dumb settler to collect and bring back to settlement so animals eat the fish and settlers die always.

Clear to say bad programming and I am sure their will be some menu you go in to and preform a sixteen point click exercise to get them to return food.

Not that great of a game. It has crashed and made me lose progress a few times which was very frustrating. Also not really any tutorials or instructions for making progress in the mid-late game.

Relatively easy achievements tho, just a couple of grindy ones
I actually love this game but I am going to give it a thumbs down based on the fact that the autosave freezes the game for well over 5 seconds. Ill change my revier when they fix this

I would rather play Rimworld since the system and UI used here is very similar anyway, and Rimworld has mods for medieval playthroughs as well as ones for layers so you can build multilevel buildings. I would suggest just getting Rimworld and mod it. Rimworld is older, is recieving constant updates, has a good modding community, and overall plays a lot better than this with a lot more vanilla customization to playthroughs even before adding mods.
It's a barebones imitation of Rimworld with a medieval theme, z levels, 1/10th of the gameplay depth, and 1/100th of the modding community.

Game is completely broken!! I absolutely do not recommend unless you like to waste your time and rage. Generally it sucks asss, with barely any gameplay or content, AI doesnt work at all (probably the worse AI training and path finding iv ever seen anywhere, makes you wonder how people learn how to code)completely unbalanced in so many ways. You spend hours to build a village then 50 people come attack you, enemies walk straight through your frontline for your archers even if you block  a 1X1 entrance path with melle guys, 50 AI with no collision against 5 of your guys, being completely incompetent in combat, unable to go where you want them to go, unable to stand ground or to attack the right person, unable to go up or down ladders. Fun for all the wrong reasons. One iof the worse coded games iv played in a while/. Last but not least, i played this game 5 years ago, nearly nothing was added since then and its still in early access (cashcow), and it actually got worse since last time i played which is quite an achievement.
We're 4 years into development and settlers still can't marry.
not great. this has been done 99x ways. feels like chores on chores, and i love rimworld
meh

I enjoy the building of this game, but its all it has. outside of it, this game is so boring. the fact this has been in early access for this long is sad..the fact they are refusing to add kids and families to a medieval game is sad...but cannibalism is ok? Everytime i try to give this game a chance it feels like i am just wasting my time..

it has been 84 years since the early access release
unfortunately the game development advances at a snails pace.
Low on features, but high on potential. But until/unless the optimization is fixed I cannot recommend it. The game collapses down to frames per minute after getting to the mid game.

Unfinished rubbish of the game.
Victim of "early access" indie games boom.

Don't buy. Avoid.
